___beautifyOutput.description: when set to true, the generated xml output will be send through a beautifier to get consistent output.(default "false")

___defaultLanguage.description: the native language used in your templates (default "en")

___i18nFormat.description: "xlf" for XLIFF 1.2 or "xlf2" for XLIFF 2.0 or "xmb" for XML Message Bundles (default "xlf")

___apikey.description: API key for usage of Google Translate.

___allowIdChange.description: flag, wether xliffmerge should merge transunits with changed IDs. (default "false")

___targetSuffix.description: when the flag `useSourceAsTarget` is set and a source is copied to target, then the target string will be suffixed by this value.

___targetPraefix.description: when the flag `useSourceAsTarget` is set and a source is copied to target, then the target string will be praefixed by this value.

___supportNgxTranslate.description: flag to active json translation files for ngx-translate (default "false")

___autotranslate.description: flag, if new units should be automatically translated by Google Translate. List of languages is also allowed. (default "false")

___preserveOrder.description: when set to true, new trans units will be at the same position as in the master file. When set to false, they will be added at the end (default "true")

___useSourceAsTarget.description: flag, if source should be copied to target for new trans-units (default "true")

___encoding.description: expected encoding of xlf, xlf2 or xmb files (default "UTF-8")

___genDir.description: directory, where files are written to (normally identical with srcDir) (default ".")

___apikeyfile.description: file that contains API key for usage of Google Translate.

___languages.description: list of languages (if not specified at command line)

___ngxTranslateExtractionPattern.description: defines what messages are exported to json translation files for ngx-translate.

___removeUnusedIds.description: flag, if unused IDs should be removed during merge (default "true")

___srcDir.description: directory, where the master file is expected (default ".")
